lines.text:
[a smoking Riggs and Murtaugh have been assigned to guard Leo]
This stinks!
I don't give a fuck, Riggs. That's why I don't have an ulcer, because I know when to say "I don't give a fuck."
[They go to leave]
And Riggs.
What?
[Murphy throws Riggs a desktop no smoking sign]
You know what that says?
Yeah, the same thing as that.
[Points to a no smoking sign on the door]
But I don't give a fuck!
[Riggs leaves. Murphy and Murtaugh look at each other]
You're lucky. I have to live with that.
[last lines]
I'm too old for this shit.
[Rudd fires at Riggs, hitting him several times. Riggs falls, writhing in pain. Arjen's gun clicks empty. Roger aims at him]

[shouting]
DROP IT, ARJEN RUDD!

[weakly]
Rog...

[holds up his wallet]
Diplomatic immunity.
[Roger slowly rolls his head on his neck, takes aim, and fires - his bullet goes through Rudd's wallet, and then his head]
It's just been revoked.
[after receiving the wrong order at the drive-thru]

They FUCK YOU at the drive-thru, okay? They FUCK YOU at the drive-thru! They know you're gonna be miles away before you find out you got fucked! They know you're not gonna turn around and go back, they don't care. So who gets fucked? Ol' Leo Getz! Okay, sure! I don't give a fuck! I'm not eating this tuna, okay?
[after seeing Rianne's commercial on TV]
Hey what's with you Rog? She was great, she was beautiful.
Yeah, I liked it. She made me want to go out and buy rubbers right now!
We're back, we're bad, you're black, I'm mad.
[Roger is sitting on a boobytrapped toilet]
Why didn't they plant the bomb in Trish's stove?
Yeah. Think of all the needless suffering that could've ended there!
[both laugh]
I'm gonna die on a toilet, aren't I?
Guys like you don't die on toilets.
Hey, hey. Did you get them? The bad guys? Are they all gone?
Yeah. Hey, hey. They've been... de-kaffir-nated.
[Riggs is about to drive up onto the center divider of an overpass in Trish's new car during pursuit]
You're not going to make it!
Yes, I will.

[anxiously]
There's not enough room!
There's plenty of room, sure I'll make it!
[runs the car up onto the divider, scraping it along a metal guard-rail]

[screaming as sparks fly]
Ah, my side panel!

[ignoring Roger and shouting to driver blocking lane beside them]
Move over! Move over!

[to other driver]
Move over, mother fucker!
[after a wild car chase, the car looks like a wreck]
This was a new car, Riggs...
Well, it still is!

[holds up a gold pen]
Is this your pen?
Thanks,
[takes it]
I keep losing it.
[he goes back to cuting up the vegetables]
Something's wrong.
Naw, not really, just another goddamn pen.
[He ignores her for awhile]
You were saying about the pen.
Oh, it just reminds me of something thats all.
Reminds you of what?
Ah, reminds me of the night Vicki was killed.

[pause]
I didn't mean to push.
Hang on that ok, we never talked about this did we.
[pauses]
Well, I supposed to be meeting her for dinner and you know one of those romantic dinners for two. I was up to my eyeballs in work and I forgot about the whole thing.
[puts the cut up vegetables into a pot]

I guess she waited in the restaurant for an hour before she decided to drive home alone. It was midnight before I got home, I got home to a ringing phone, do naturally I answered it. They told me she was killed in a car crash.
[pauses]

I should have been driving, I guess we would have been all right, huh. Anyway I remember falling down on my knees and I started shaking all over and I remember thinking I'm losing it, I'm losing it. So there I was lying on the living room floor. Lying there and I'm seeing under the couch and I see this gold pen. Gold pen just lying under the couch, I've been looking, haven't seen it in two months, there it is.
[laughs slightly]

She wasn't much of a housekeeper. And this voice goes off inside my head, kind a like a drill instructor, I really heard it. It said GET UP NOW. I didn't feel like it but I got up, muscles were still working and I drove to the hospital and identified her in the morgue and signed her out with my gold pen.

[walks in]
Gold pen? Hey, Trish found one in the laundry the other day.
[Trish and Martin look at each other]
[Riggs has dislocated his shoulder to escaped from a straight-jacket for a bet]
How the hell do you do that man?
Well, I dislocated my shoulder one time and I can do it whenever I want.
God damn man, doesn't that hurt?
Yes it does but not as much as when I put it back in!
[Slams his shoulder into an office partition wall]
Well if it isn't Mrs. Sigmund Fraud.
My door is always open.
Well, I think we should keep this on a professional level, don't you, Doc?
Why do you do this to yourself Riggs?
Well, who else am I supposed to do it to? None of them'll let me. Besides, I need the money.
[McGee uses a nail gun, Riggs and Murtaugh drop to the floor, guns drawn]
Hey, Jesus Christ! What the hell's wrong with you guys?
I'm sorry, that's very uncool.
You're sorry? Check my shorts, for Christ's sake!
[about to pull Murtaugh off the booby-trapped toilet]
On three, what do ya say?
Okay.
One... two...
Wait, wait, wait!
What?
Do we do it on three? Or one, two, three, then do it?
It's your ass, Cochise!
My ass, yeah. On three.
We go on three?
Yeah.
[after shooting 2 criminals with a nail gun]
Nailed you both!
You are not dead until I tell you! Got that Riggs?
I'm not a cop tonight, Rog. This is personal.
[after the envoys states that Murtaugh can't go to South Africa because he's black]
Of course I'm black. That's why I want to go to South Africa.

[louder and more militant]
To join my oppressed brothers as they take up the struggle against this racist, fascist, White Minority Regime!
Racist White Regime!
One man, one vote!
One man, one vote!

[Loudly]
Free South Africa you dumb son of a bitch!
You dumb son of a bitch!
That's quite enough! Get out!
[Security tries to remove Getz and Murtaugh, resuting in a full scale riot inside and outside the Consulate]
Mr. Getz got away. A missed opportunity and he gets away. He slips right through our fingers, and into the hands of the police.
[catches Pieter staring at the floor around him]
What are you doing?
I was just checking to see if I was standing on plastic.
[shouting at the driver while hanging onto the bonnet of a moving car]
I'd like to see your drivers license and proof of insurance!
[Riggs falls of the car]
Hey, this is a real nice hobby room. All you need now is a hobby!
George... Home!... Out!
But sir, I...
George, I got a gun!
Yes Sir!
Mr. Murtaugh has a gun.
Yeah, but it's an old gun and he's not a very good shot.
[Ribbing Murtaugh about his daughter's television ad for condoms]
In one ear, out the RUBBER...
This stinks!
I don't give a fuck, Riggs. That's why I don't have an ulcer, because I know when to say "I don't give a fuck."
Police! Open up!
How do I know it's the police?
After I shoot you through the door, you can examine the bullet. Open up!
[after Riggs and Leo have a rude confrontation]
Oh I get it.
[Points to Riggs then Murtaugh]
Bad cop, good cop.
Shut up.
Oh okay, bad cop, bad cop.
[after falling into a hotel swimming pool]
Where were you man? You my partner or what? Why didn't you follow me down?
Yeah, why didn't you follow him down?
Shut up! From seven floors up?
What is going on down here?
Freeze dickhead! Get down here dickhead. Come on, it's been a bad day!
[Murtaugh is lying on top of Riggs in the bath, after the explosion]
Get off me man! I don't want anybody to see us like this!
[Riggs confronts Rudd and his minions in their office]
Hey, don't bother calling the police. I'm here already.
I should have known.
Well, well... it's the master race!
I hope you realize the trouble you are in right now.
Well, as usual, you people have everything all upside down and turned around and back to front.
I'm surprised you haven't heard of me, I got a bad reputation, like sometimes I just go nuts like now ha ha!
[Vorstedt and his goons have broken into Murtaugh's house and have gagged him and Trish]
I bet you're wondering what we've done to your kids, aren't ya?
[squeals and groans from the Murtaugh's]
I'll bet your mind is going fucking bananas, isn't it?
[more squeals and groans]
Now this has just been a warning. Next time it will get bloody. Now you tell your people to *back off*. Don't you go being a smart kaffir. Perhaps we'll let you live, ja.
[Vorstedt and goons leave]
[after Riggs threatened Rudd in his office]
Just get out of here, Kaffir-lover!

[pointing his gun at each of Rudd's henchman]
Eeny... Meeny... Meinie...
[points at Vorstedt for a long moment]

[a la Curly from the Three Stooges]
Hey Moe!
[Riggs shoots the fish tank, causing water and fishes to spill everywhere]

[mock saluting]
Big Smile! Big Smile! BIG SMILE!
[Riggs leaves]
[Riggs sitting by the shore with his dog, Sam]
Hey, did anyone ever tell you if you sit on the rocks too long, you get piles? Come on, lets get out of here.
I'm Leo Getz, and whatever you want, Leo gets.
[Admiring the view over L.A]
That's downtown L.A. How would you like to have a house up here?
Well, it would be okay on the three days of the year when you can actually see it!
[Leo Getz explaining money laundering]
Okay, okay, okay, okay, this is the best part okay? You make a tax deduction on interest payments you don't even make! Am I an innovator? Am I a genius?
You're a swindler!
Cheat!
Everyone cheats a little bit... look at the Pentagon!
Now we DO have a serious diplomatic situation here, which I will be taking up with your state department first thing in the morning.
Whoa, you got me quakin' in my boots, but I'm still gonna bring you down.
My dear officer, you could not even give me a parking ticket!
[At the South African Consulate]
How you doin'?
[his handshake is ignored by the Envoy]
I think there must be some mistake.
Say what?
Listen to your friend here, he knows what he's talking about. I don't think you want to go to South Africa.
Why not?
Because you're black!

[to Murtaugh]
You are.
[to Envoy]
He is.
What are you doing here?
Oh, I've just been upstairs with your boss, shooting the breeze... shooting his fish.
Rudd's hiding behind his diplomatic credentials, isn't he?
He's not a very good guy, your boss.
Then whatever he's doing, he shouldn't get away with it.
[Riggs and Rika are in bed]
I think it's time for the seventh inning stretch.
[pause]
That's a baseball expression.
I know. But we're only up to the fourth inning.
Batter up!
I was going to offer you a drink, Riggs, but I hear you're on the wagon these days.
Yeah, that stuff'll kill you quick. Listen, you know so much about me; who the hell are you?

I'm the guy that changes the course of your life, man. 4 years ago, Riggs, when you were a narc off Long Beach, you were getting too close to us so we put a contract out on you. I handled it myself; drove your car right off the fucking road, remember? Now, of course, you weren't driving. You can't imagine the surprise. I pulled back this matted mop of blood-soaked hair to see this woman's face... your wife, right? She didn't die straightaway... took a bit of time.
[Riggs angrily charges for Vorstedt, but is restrained]
Don't know much luck with women, do you, Riggs?
[Riggs has accosted Rudd, Vorstedt and several other consulate thugs in Rudd's office]

I'll make you a deal, Arjen, or Aryan, or whatever the fuck your name is, I'll make you a little deal. You fold up your tents - and get the fuck out of my country - and I won't do anything to you. I'll leave you alone.
[points his gun at Arjen's face]
Cause if you stick around here, I'm gonna FUCK YOUR ASS.
[Murtaugh is holding a wounded Riggs in his arms after killing Aryan]
Hey Rog, could you reach into my pocket there?
[Murtaugh reaches into Riggs's pants pocket, and pulls out a pack of cigarettes, thinking he wants a last smoke before he dies]
Here you go.
I, I want you to throw those things away, those things'll kill ya.
Hey hey hey! Listen, if we're going, shouldn't I have a gun?
NO!
[Vorstedt bursts in on Wyler in the middle of a weight routine]
Hello, Wyler. This just isn't your day. Just like your buddy, Murtaugh. Tell me something. Have your brains ever seen the light of day?
Who the fuck do you think you are, man? I'm a cop!
No. You *were* a cop, Wyler.
[shoots him]
[explaining to Rika about the altercation with the police]

You see, my dear, the policies of our government are not very popular in this country. And the police force in this city is *overrun* with blacks. They have badges and guns and they *hate* us. Our consulate staff, particularly myself, will always be victims of their harassment.
Eeenie, Meenie, Miennie...
[quickly]
Hey, Moe!
Do you like your chili with or without crushed Oreos?
She's got a great body. She makes you want to buy rubbers.
[Riggs crouches down under Roger's toilet, and sees the bomb planted there]
Tell me I'm not fucked.

[under his breath]
He's fucked...
[louder]
Well, okay, but I'd be lying.
Certain policemen in this city have become an intolerable nuisance. They are obviously onto us again. How do you propose to handle it?

[with cigarette in mouth]
Warn them off. It's my experience that a scared cop is more useful than a dead one.
A warning? Is that not a bit tame?
Depends on how you do it.
[about 25 minutes later into film after a very scary warning that still didn't stop the police from bothering them]
Things are getting out of hand. We are suffering too many losses. We have to move the cash in one large shipment.
We'll need something bigger than a suitcase.
I'll worry about that. You worry about the police. The warning did not work.
Hey, Hey, what's that your eating dad?
My tuna fish sandwich
TUNA!
Daddy, you can't eat tuna
I can't eat what
Mom, dad killed flipper

[as Rianne points to her shirt]
We're boycotting tuna honey because they kill the dolphins that get's caught in the nets, ONLY albacore
Alba what
why don't have a ham sandwich
Hey, eat Miss Piggy instead

[Rianne laughs and accidentally slaps Martin in the face]
Oh, I'm sorry
It's only my eye

[to Martin]
Ha, Ha, Ha
[after being sealed into a ship container, Riggs and Murtaugh turn on the lights and find themselves surrounded by bales of money]
Holy shit... thousands... freakin' millions!
[pulls out a handful]
These are thousand dollar bills! Man, with what I'm holding in my hand, I could put all my kids through college.
Why don't you take it?

[after a pause, throws the money down]
Fuckin' drug money, man!
So what? Do something good with it. Rudd's not gonna need it, not where he's going.
[Murtaugh and Riggs are sealed into a cargo container]
Load the container. By the time anyone finds their bodies, they'll be in Cape Town.
[as the container is being lifted, the car inside bursts out and crashes into the bay, spilling bales of money into water]

[staring]
Our money... just make sure they're dead.
Certain policemen in this city have become an intolerable nuisance. They are obviously onto us again. How do you propose to handle the situation?
Warn them off. It's my experience that a scared cop is more useful than a dead one.
A warning... is that not a bit tame?
Depends how you do it.
[after Riggs just destroyed a house on a cliff]
Riggs, you crazy son of a bitch!
Murtaugh, all that damage you caused downtown is comin' out of the department's budget!
Fine. Pay it off in Krugerrands.
Don't make jokes, Murtaugh, make arrests!
[In Rudd's office, Hans meets Rudd & Vorstedt after losing the Krugerrands in the chase]
Hans, come in.
[points in front of his desk]
Mind the plastic. I'm having some painting done. Well now, the important thing is, are you all right? Any broken bones?
I'm fine, thank you, Mr. Rudd.
Only a few bumps and bruises, eh?
Yes, that's all.
Good, good.
[pause]
However, we did lose over a million dollars in Krugerrand.
I know. I'm sorry, Mr. Rudd. It happens.
Ah, it's not your fault. Sometimes these things do not go as planned. As you say, they just happen... eh, Pieter?
[Pieter shoots Hans. He falls dead onto the plastic, and Pieter starts wrapping its edges around his body]
You give a new meaning to the phrase "drop-cloth," Mr. Rudd.
Another day, another hobby.
Yeah another day, another hobby. What's new?
[repeated line]
Okay!
